It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on all aspects of life. In fact, some of the questions here will not apply to your experiences; others may prove impossible for you to answer, so don't worry about leaving blank spaces.

If there is a particular area which you feel should be included, or if there are particular events, if they help to answer the question.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada between 1900 and 1945 and may be interested in your life story personal experiences of the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or supply for a separate questionnaire.

Other Questionnaires

Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire No. 1, entitled "Pioneer Days," that has already answered this and would be willing to do so, please put a check mark here ( ).

Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire on other subjects will be prepared at a later date, some of these are listed below. Please mark the ones you would be willing to answer.

Transmittal of Questionnaires

All questionnaires will be preserved in the Saskatchewan Archives Board's Office at the University of Saskatchewan as part of the permanent record of our province. Please send your completed questionnaire to:

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
Saskatoon, Sask.
Ferguson, Daniel
Sask., Sask.

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL INTERVIEW

NOTE: Please print all proper names and place names in capital letters. If you are not sure the name is correct as you have given it, please say so. If you rather have someone else do the writing at your discretion, this is quite acceptable.

1. Your full name: DANGLE, FERGUSON.
2. Your address: B.E.A.T.T.Y., SASK.
3. Date: JUNE 2, 1952.
4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country)
   PRICEVILLE, ONTARIO, CANADA.
5. What was your father's name and occupation?
   REV. DANIEL FERGUSON — farmer-minister — Mennonite Church.
6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and year)
   APRIL 1902.
7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates wherever possible.
8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you may say "I was in my teens," etc.)
9. What were your reasons for coming West?
   Twenty acres.
   To homestead.
10. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it? Railroads or government information?)
    Through advertisements and general talk — western farms in the air.
1. Your full name: DANIEL FERGUSON

2. Your address: BEATY, SASK.

3. Date: JUNE 2, 1942

4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country)

5. What was your father's name and occupation?

6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and year)

7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates wherever possible.

8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you are under 18 years of age.)

9. What were your reasons for coming here?

Twenty acres

It's homestead

10. How did you learn about the farm? (Through other people? Reading about it?)

Through advertisement and general talk - whether from an air.
11. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada? They thought it was a good idea.

12. Did you travel yourself or with a party (family, friends or other group)? Yes

13. What means of transportation did you use? Railways - C.P. & Regina (spent four summers as host help on family's farm near Brown, 10 miles north of Regina)

14. What incidents of the journey best do you remember? (People you met on the way, meetings with Indians, adventures or other excitement etc.)

Will all seeing the open prairie -

Journey was merry with singing.

Our group entertained with my violin and ballads of old Ontario.

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan? Worked for Alec Brown on farm.

16. Where did you settle or take up land? Nearby present village of Appleby (1902)

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan. West home (Ont.) in July 9, 1902 - Came back in spring of '03

Worked on railway (repair crew) between Regina and Prince Albert for summer - back to homestead in June 9, 1903.

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How after you came?

Farmer for Mother and brothers in Ontario

Farmer - worked on Railway - Carpentry in homestead district while farming on homestead.

In 1916 - Star in Quailier (Boarding house)

Back to farming again
11. What did your relatives and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada? They thought it was a good idea.

12. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends or other groups)? Yes, I traveled with my family.

13. What mode of transportation did you use? We used the railway.

14. What incidents of the journey West do you remember? (People you met on the way, meetings with Indians, adventures on the journey, accidents or other excitement etc.)

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan? We stayed at Alec Brown's farm.

16. When did you settle or take up land? We settled in 1902.

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan. We lived in Prince Albert.

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How about you now? I farmed for my father and worked in Ontario. Now I work as a carpenter in Prince Albert.

19. In 1916 - stay in Quilchena (Poveshell & Boarding house) Back to farming again.
19. How often did you write to relatives or friends in your old home?

Occasionally.

20. If you got married, give the name of your husband or wife along with the date and place of marriage.

Married to William Anderson, Aug 22, 1906

21. Did anyone else come to Saskatchewan because of your recommendation? If so, where did they settle?

My brother Archie Ferguson came back with me in 1903

22. If other members of your family (brothers, sisters, parents, etc.) came West tell when they came and where they settled.

ARCHIE FERGUSON - in 1903 -

Homesteaded at Cypress Lake.

23. Is there any particular experience of pioneer days that stands out in your memory which you would like to recount?

Neighbourhood of people - Community gatherings - all young people settled in farms about - homes were opened up turn for dance & parties - Mat music was played - some accordions - and mouth organs.

24. Did you travel about much in the early years? (for business attending church, visiting friends, etc.) How far? By what means of travel?

23. Is there any particular experiences or pioneer days that stand out in your memory which you like to recount?

Neighborhood of people - Community gatherings - all young people settled in farms about - homes were opened up time for dance & parties - Most music was violin - some accordion and mouth organ.

34. Did any people move away from your district prior to 1944? What reasons did they have for moving?

No.

Put in name and other, were chased out by drought.

35. Did many people move away during the 1930s? Did many return?

We were at Butte by then (1922) and people from the prairie were moving in to their district then.
